articles.title: EU parliament slams Boris Johnson’s ‘Fawlty Towers approach to politics’

articles.content:

articles.title: Andrew Grice | The Independent
articles.description: The latest breaking news, comment and features from The Independent.
articles.content: Andrew Grice is a political columnist for The Independent, having been its political editor from 1998 to 2015. He has worked in Westminster since 1982 and unearthed many political scoops.

articles.author: Andrew Grice
articles.title: The promise of tax cuts, the oldest trick in the Tory book, will not save Johnson’s skin
articles.description: Never mind if the sums don’t add up; in the PM’s world, you can have your cake and eat it, spend more on the living standards crisis and reduce taxes at the same time
articles.content: As Boris Johnson fights for his political life, he is raising the prospect that his new chancellor Nadhim Zahawi will cut taxes in a way that the now departed Rishi Sunak refused to do. The prime min… [+5241 chars]

articles.title: 1922 committee: Tory MPs demand immediate rule change to force Boris Johnson from No 10
articles.description: Ex-minister Chris Skidmore says 1922 committee should ‘urgently reconsider rules’
articles.content:

articles.title: People will say he was self-serving – but the Sajid Javid I know doesn’t work that way
articles.description: I worked closely with him for more than five years in government. It is obvious that he of all people would be the one to say ‘enough is enough’, writes Salma Shah

articles.author: Sean O'Grady
articles.title: It’s finally over for Boris Johnson – those who work most closely with the PM have given up on him
articles.description: There’s no doubt fresh leadership will revitalise the government, but the old challenges – like Brexit – will remain
articles.content:
